title: Tadoba Andhari Tiger Reserve
subtitle: Maharashtra’s Oldest and Largest National Park
overview: Tadoba Andhari Tiger Reserve, located in Chandrapur district of Maharashtra, is the state’s oldest and largest national park. Spread over 625 sq. km, it is part of India’s renowned tiger conservation network.

The park is a blend of Tadoba National Park and Andhari Wildlife Sanctuary, making it rich in biodiversity. It offers a unique ecosystem of dense teak forests, grasslands, and tranquil lakes that attract nature lovers and wildlife photographers from all over the world.

highlights.title: Tiger Safari
highlights.description: Spotting majestic Bengal tigers in their natural habitat is the main highlight of Tadoba. Jeep safaris offer thrilling encounters with wildlife.

highlights.title: Rich Flora & Fauna
highlights.description: Home to tigers, leopards, sloth bears, deer, crocodiles, and over 200 species of birds, Tadoba boasts incredible ecological diversity.

geography.intro: Located in the Chandrapur district of Maharashtra, Tadoba lies within the Deccan plateau region, featuring dry deciduous forests and hilly terrain.

climate.description: Tadoba experiences a tropical climate with distinct summer, monsoon, and winter seasons. The best time for tiger sightings is between February and May.

seasons.text: Summer (March–May): Hot and dry, ideal for animal sightings near water sources.
Monsoon (June–September): Lush green surroundings, fewer safaris operate.
Winter (November–February): Pleasant climate and active birdlife.

geography.conclusion: The terrain of Tadoba is a perfect mix of forested hills, meadows, and water bodies, offering a complete wildlife experience.

activities.title: Jungle Safari
activities.description: Guided jeep safaris provide close encounters with wildlife, especially tigers, leopards, and deer.
info: Available in core and buffer zones

activities.title: Wildlife Photography
activities.description: Capture the vibrant biodiversity, from majestic predators to colorful birds.

activities.title: Nature Trails
activities.description: Guided nature walks let you explore Tadoba’s rich flora, insects, and bird species safely.

attractions.title: Tadoba Lake
attractions.description: A serene lake surrounded by bamboo and teak forests, frequented by crocodiles and birds.

attractions.title: Moharli Gate
attractions.description: Main entrance to the reserve and the best access point for safaris and accommodation.

marineLife.intro: Although Tadoba is a forest ecosystem, its lakes and rivers sustain a small but rich aquatic ecosystem.

items.title: Freshwater Fish
items.description: Tadoba Lake and Andhari River support native freshwater fish and amphibians.

items.title: Amphibians
items.description: Frogs, toads, and reptiles thrive in the moist forest zones, maintaining the ecological balance.

conclusion: The aquatic habitats enhance Tadoba’s biodiversity.
They attract migratory birds and provide water sources for wildlife.

howToReach.title: By Train
details: Well connected to Nagpur and Mumbai

howToReach.title: By Air
details: Regular flights from Mumbai, Pune, and Delhi

howToReach.title: By Road
details: Tadoba is accessible by road from Chandrapur and Nagpur
Private cabs and MSRTC buses available

bookingTips.description: Book safari permits online in advance from Maharashtra Forest Department’s official portal.
Best months to visit are February to May for tiger sightings.
Carry binoculars, sunscreen, and light cotton clothes for safaris.
